children.subject: Not an eecs class but I took math 104 for a technical elective, I found the content to be really beautiful.

Favorite lower division: CS70. I really enjoyed the range of topics covered in the class along with the sort of puzzle-y problems they gave. Favorite specific topics were bijections (e.g. proving how (0,1] have the same amount of real numbers as [1,infinty)) and the probability portion.

Favorite upper division: CS170. I generally like theory / algorithms so this class fell right into that.

Favorite non-eecs class: Math 113. I haven't taken too many non eecs classes but I enjoyed Math 113 as everything taught was completely new to me. I enjoyed having a class where I had zero prior experience of the material and was learning new things every class. Note: I don't think Math 113 is useful to 99.99% of what most eecs/cs majors will do but I found the class fun nevertheless.

Favorite non-theory class: CS162. I enjoyed understand how real computers operate and filling in the gaps between hardware and software (so I can now sort of understand a computer program starts from lines of codes and gets executed at the hardware level). I actually think that 162 should be a required class for eecs/cs majors due to its material but that's a slight tangent. A big shoutout to my 162 group as well who made the class 10 times more enjoyable

Honorable mentions for me would be 61C (nice lower division class that starts to fill in the gaps between hardware and software) and EE126 (class really encourages tackling problems from different perspectives and covers an interesting range of probability topics).

my favorite class so far has probably been CS188! projects and homework were always fun, and the material was super interesting. I thought 170 exams were fun and the material was interesting, but I hated the problem sets (mostly because I hate writing proofs and just ...... didn't do them .....). I also absolutely loved CS70 -- the material was fascinating, especially since I love math.

Personally I thought Math 110 was the coolest course that I’ve taken here! It was pretty cool to see all these basic assumptions you make in 54 and prove them (AKA prove that matrix multiplication is the equivalent of composing two linear functions) and what the transpose of a matrix means in terms of linear functions! Would totally recommend Sug woo Shin if he’s teaching! Another really cool course would be 189. The homework’s were pretty hard but the material was extremely interesting and fun to learn. Would totally recommend as a must class for any CS major given how much it’s used now, even if you don’t end up going into the data science route.

history.content: Rising sophomore here that would love to hear about everyone's experiences with the program. This is a really open-ended question, so it could be relative to workload/difficulty, course content, industry-usefullness, the professor, etc. etc.
history.subject: What have been the most/least enjoyable classes in your EECS/CS career?
